text: Howard Hollis Callaway, known as Bo Callaway (April 2, 1927 -March 15, 2014) was an American politician and businessman. He served as Secretary of the Army from 1973 to 1975. He was also a United States representative from Georgia. Callaway was born in LaGrange, Georgia. In 1949 he graduated from West Point with a degree in military engineering. He died in Atlanta, Georgia from a brain hemorrhage, aged 86. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:1927 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Businesspeople from Georgia (U.S. state) Category:Deaths from cerebral hemorrhage Category:Disease-related deaths in Georgia (U.S. state) Category:Politicians from Georgia (U.S. state) Category:United States representatives from Georgia Category:United States Secretaries of the Army Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians
title: Bo Callaway
